I already explained this. The source does not refer to anarcho-capitalism as a form of individualist anarchism, but rather as a descendent of it, hence the term "reborn"

This book never even mentions anarcho-capitalism, instead simply saying that individualism is "associated" with Rothbard and Nozick. Was Nozick an AC? Nope
This book does not refer to anarcho-capitalists as individualist anarchists, but rather links the former as descended from the later and states the fact that some descendents call themselves ACs
This book does not refer to anarcho-capitalism as a form of individualist anarchim, but rather claims that individualism died and was "reborn" as anarcho-capitalism
This book explicitly makes clear that capitalism is incompatible with anarchism, the referance is being misused

This gives the incorrect impression that Anarcho-capitalism and Individualist Anarchism are synonymous. AC is at best a subset, and many IAs are explicit socialists. This is an ongoing debate.
another source
mcelroy does not refer to herself as an anarcho-capitalist. She says in this source that she is a "Rothbardian and individualist anarchist"
McElroy does refer to herself as an anarcho-capitalist, and individualist anarchist is not a syn for AC
aka individualist anarchism.......with a footnote
there is plenty of evidence that they're individualist anarchists, Look at all the sources listed at the bottom of the article.
There is no evidence, just an assertion, that most indiv anarchists are ancaps. Regardless, all indiv anarchists before Rothbard, meaning most of the famous ones, were not ancaps. Not synonyms.
indiv anarchism and anarcho-capitalism are synonyms, because almost all individualists are anarcho-capitalists
rv - exactly, ancap is only one of a myriad of types of individualist anarchism, including mutualist/socialist types. Alternative names are included later on. indiv and ancap are not synonyms.
Yes it is. Anarcho-capitalism is one of many forms of individualist anarchism. And it is often known simply as "individualist anarchism"
rv, [[individualist anarchism]] and anarcho-capitalism are not the same.
